TopicTitle: What did you get for christmas?

Articles.Content:
What did you get for christmas?

I got a nerf gun, 1100 kapla's, a snowscooter, 1000NOK from my grandmother, some kind of traditional german treebear (also from my grandmother), a book, a title as lord (so if i was british i could write lord before my name in my passport) and a cool tetris "epic fail" cup.

I'm curious!
Are you on timewarp? It's 24th here, we just had lunch.

It's still Christmas Eve here in Western Hemisphere. But i already got my gift, lots of money from my parents and distant relatives.

The adult in me says to spend it on Beer and Electronics. The child in me says to spend it on Beer, electronics, nerf guns and candy.

Early Christmas gifts:

Euro Truck simulator 2 gold

NFS Rivals

Even earlier:

Trackmania 2 3 pack.

T-9 hours.

Since i'm going a way for a week on the 26th, my parents gave me a few gifts yesterday. I got a new weatherproof jacket, and a Savage Arms .308 rifle.

Edited December 24, 2013 by xzxvrx

Here in Latin America, we open the presents at 12:00 a.m., after having a great buffet.

One of my presents looks like a book, but you know how it is when you have a little sister. She's getting all the big gifts.

T -8h.

So far it's just my sometimes poor impulse control meeting the steam sale (Tomb Raider, Solar 2, TES Oblivion, Viscera: Santas Rampage, and Arma 3). The actual gifts wait until Christmas Day (which is a few hours off yet).

Twix bars, Snicker bars, a book, 2 pairs of gloves, a sweater, some money, a gift card and a comp upgrade. i5 like a baws.

Also, I see you're from Norway. Just FYI, Americans, Brits, and many more have gift opening on Christmas day.

Early Christmas gifts:

Euro Truck simulator 2 gold

NFS Rivals

Even earlier:

Trackmania 2 3 pack.

T-9 hours.

Already forgot, did you now?

I wish it was Christmas...still 13 hours until I even wake up.

You know, that some of us in the western hemisphere didn't get Christmas yet

But a early Christmas gift was a $1400 computer

The best things i got this year was a 64 GB SD card that fits all the way into my Macbook, a nice Scarf and a great book about modern Aircraft.

some kind of traditional german treebear
May i ask what that is? The only thing i found on the web is "Racoon" but i highly doubt thats what you got from your grandmother.

I got money, which I used to order 3 Nanoblock sets, 300 ft of paracord, and 2 books. In the way of Nanoblock sets, I ordered the Space Shuttle, the Empire State Building, and the White house, and have so far built the Shuttle. It looks fantastic but was a terrible pain to assemble because of the small blocks. I got these two books:

First one is an accompanying book for a US Naval education course (But it's absolutely wonderful for separate reading and study), and the other one is a book about the history of the early oil days when the world's oil came from the hills of Western Pennsylvania. I'm a history buff and the early-to-mid oil industry, the USSR, and Colonial America are what interest me the most in the topic. Outside of that, I'm a big nonfiction fan, real stories and information draw me in and captivate me whereas I have to force myself to read fiction, and the stories are never as satisfying as NF reading.

P.S., It isn't X-mas where I live yet, but I wanted to get my things before X-mas because as far as I know UPS doesn't deliver on the 25th.

Edited December 25, 2013 by Flymetothemun
I got a bottle of Jack Daniels and some loving from my old lady ( wife\girl in biker speak )
One of the things I will get (already have) is a bad cold.
Don't know yet. Its only 2AM here. Time to get to sleep, I guess.
Australia here, I got a bunch of wonderful parts to upgrade my computer. I'm now rocking 2 GTX 760's in SLI! Now I just need to upgrade my CPU...
I got a Razer Nostromo gaming keypad, flint and steel, a Swiss watch, 100Ã¢â€šÂ¬ and a compressed T-shirt(plus a trip to the theatre)

Well, my mom gave me an early present of an Xbox One, and my neighbors gave me peppermint pie, a $20.00 gift card for GameStop, a green stuffed dog, and a little bag of candy, and my step mom & dad gave me a PS+ subscription for Xmas Eve. I'm currently awaiting my step mom & dad to wake up for the unwrapping of our Xmas presents.
I'm staring at them right now...they are taunting me.
I got a joystick, the T-Flight Hotas X, from my dad. So far, it works just fine.
I got a PS4 with BF4. Awesome. I also got a super cool Smithsonian animal and plant encyclopedia.

A hammock, two huge books, a new set of speakers, lots of chocolates and cookies, a bunch of movies, and a bad-ass 1cm diameter HDMI cable.

Not bad for not having asked for stuff.
A coffee pot, a new cellphone and this.
Ok, a ton of clothes. A pouch for my gas mask, new earbuds, a 720p camera to mount on an RC plane and a razor (I'm too young to need to shave). And helping my mom setup her Microsoft Surface...

A sweater, a pretty awesome dress shirt and some obligatory sweet-ish stuff

...this thread reminds me that I still have to come up with some gifts for friends, though
